inputs.name: additional_patient_ids
inputs._description:
Comma separated list of Patient IDs that together with the Patient
ID from the SMART App Launch contain all MUST SUPPORT elements.

inputs.name: implantable_device_codes
inputs._description: Enter the code for an Implantable Device type, or multiple codes separated by commas. If blank, Inferno will validate all Device resources against the Implantable Device profile

inputs.name: bulk_server_url
inputs._description: The URL of the Bulk FHIR server.

inputs.name: group_id
inputs._description: The Group ID associated with the group of patients to be exported.

inputs.name: bulk_patient_ids_in_group
inputs._description:
Comma separated list of every Patient ID that is in the specified Group. This information is provided by
the system under test to verify that data returned matches expectations. Leave blank to not verify Group
inclusion.

inputs.name: bulk_device_types_in_group
inputs._title: Implantable Device Type Codes in exported Group
inputs._description:
Comma separated list of every Implantable Device type that is in the specified Group. This information is
provided by the system under test to verify that data returned matches expectations. Leave blank to verify
all Device resources against the Implantable Device profile.

inputs.name: lines_to_validate
inputs._title: Limit validation to a maximum resource count

inputs.name: bulk_timeout
inputs._description:
While testing, Inferno waits for the server to complete the exporting task. If the calculated totalTime is
greater than the timeout value specified here, Inferno bulk client stops testing. Please enter an integer
for the maximum wait time in seconds. If timeout is less than 1, Inferno uses default value 180. If the
  timeout is greater than 600 (10 minutes), Inferno uses the maximum value 600.

value.requested_scopes: system/*.read
system/*.r
system/*.r

inputs.name: since_timestamp
inputs._description: A timestamp formatted as a FHIR instant which will be used to test the server's support for the `_since` query parameter

inputs.name: token_revocation_attestation
inputs._title: The Health IT developer demonstrated a patient's request for revoking the tokens provided during the patient standalone launch within the last hour

inputs.name: ehr_patient_smart_auth_info
inputs._title: EHR Launch with Patient Scopes Credentials

inputs.name: custom_authorization_header
inputs._title: Custom HTTP Headers for Introspection Request
inputs._description:
Add custom headers for the introspection request by adding each header's name and value with a new line
            between each header.
            Ex:
              <Header 1 Name>: <Value 1>

inputs.name: optional_introspection_request_params
inputs._description: Any additional parameters to append to the request body, separated by &. Example: 'param1=abc&param2=def'

inputs.name: single_patient_registration_supported
inputs._title: Health IT Module demonstrated support for application registration for single patients.

inputs.name: multiple_patient_registration_supported
inputs._title: Health IT Module demonstrated support for application registration for multiple patients.

inputs.name: resource_authorization_gui_supported
inputs._title: Health IT Module demonstrated a graphical user interface for user to authorize FHIR resources.

inputs.name: offline_access_notification_supported
inputs._title: Health IT Module informed patient when "offline_access" scope is being granted during authorization.

inputs.name: refresh_token_period_attestation
inputs._title: Health IT Module attested that it is capable of issuing refresh tokens that are valid for a period of no shorter than three months.

inputs.name: token_validation_support
inputs._title: Health IT developer demonstrated the ability of the Health IT Module / authorization server to validate token it has issued.

inputs.name: information_accuracy_attestation
inputs._title: Tester verifies that all information is accurate and without omission.

inputs.name: multi_patient_scopes_attestation
inputs._title: Information returned no greater than scopes pre-authorized for multi-patient queries.

inputs.name: developer_documentation_attestation
inputs._title: Health IT developer demonstrated the documentation is available at a publicly accessible URL.

inputs.name: jwks_cache_attestation
inputs._title: Health IT developer confirms the Health IT Module does not cache the JWK Set received via a TLS-protected URL for longer than the cache-control header indicates.

inputs.name: patient_suffix_attestation
inputs._title: Health IT developer demonstrates support for the Patient Demographics Suffix USCDI v1 element.

inputs.name: native_refresh_attestation
inputs._title: Health IT developer demonstrates support for issuing refresh tokens to native applications.

inputs.name: public_url_attestation
inputs._title: Health IT developer demonstrates the public location of its certified API technology service base URLs

inputs.name: tls_version_attestation_notes
inputs._title: Document how TLS version 1.2 or above is enforced, if required:

inputs.name: refresh_token_refresh_attestation
inputs._title: Health IT developer attested that the Health IT Module is capable of issuing refresh tokens valid for a new period of no shorter than three months without requiring re-authentication and re-authorization when a valid refresh token is supplied by the application.

inputs.name: bulk_v2_since_attestation
inputs._title: Health IT developer attested that the Health IT Module meets the requirements for supporting the `_since` parameter for bulk data exports.

inputs.name: clinical_test_scope_attestation
inputs._title: Health IT developer attested that the Health IT Module supports granting a sub resource scope for Clinical Test Observations.
